events.title: Opening of the Eiffel Tower
events.description: The Eiffel Tower was officially opened to the public during the 1889 Exposition Universelle (World's Fair) in Paris, France, showcasing innovative iron architecture.
events.significance: Became a global cultural icon of France and an architectural landmark, symbolizing modernity and engineering achievement.

events.title: Soviet Luna 10 Moon Orbiter
events.description: The Soviet spacecraft Luna 10 became the first space probe to enter orbit around the Moon, marking a significant advancement in lunar exploration.
events.significance: Pioneered human exploration of the Moon and contributed valuable scientific data about the lunar environment.

events.title: End of Persian Gulf War
events.description: The Persian Gulf War officially ended as coalition forces declared victory over Iraq following Operation Desert Storm.
events.significance: Marked the conclusion of a major conflict in the Middle East and demonstrated the effectiveness of modern coalition military operations.

events.title: Schenectady Sit-down Strike Begins
events.description: Workers at the General Electric plant in Schenectady, New York, began a sit-down strike for better working conditions and union recognition.
events.significance: Contributed to the strengthening of labor unions and improved workersâ€™ rights in the US industrial sector.

events.title: Launch of Apollo 13 Space Mission
events.description: NASA launched the Apollo 13 mission intended for lunar landing, which later became famous for its 'successful failure' after an in-flight accident jeopardized the crew.
events.significance: Demonstrated human ingenuity and problem-solving under pressure, contributing important lessons to space mission safety.
